data.title: Concert
data.text: Was just walking past and lines were gathering. Three bands I had never heard of playing that night. Beautiful building inside and out. Had a great time.

data.title: Old Dominion Show
data.text: Had a great first visit to this old theatre, turned concert venue in Richmond for the Old Dominion show.  The band was awesome, but the electric atmosphere of the concert hall made the difference!  The facility was safe, clean, staff was friendly, and everything was well orchestrated. Even the sightlines from the seating area were perfect. Facility is just a block away from 2 large hotels downtown, making it very convenient for out-of-towners.  Would definetly return for another show at this nice old place.

data.title: Bianca Del Rio- Not Today Satan! Tour
data.text: Not a bad seat in the house!  The seats were folding chairs, but they were pretty comfortable.  Beautiful old building.  Since all the seats were good, will definitely see other events there!  And well....Bianca was well....F*ing HILARIOUS!

data.title: Great venue for concerts
data.text: In the heart of Richmond, easy access, easy parking and a nice rtaurants next door.  Good acoustics,mop notch acts at reasonable prices.

data.title: Halestorm Concert May 2016
data.text:
- Very easy to get to from the highway and to find by following downtown signs. 
- We parked in a parking garage a block away and it was $7 for the night and a very safe lot. 
- The sound quality was very good for a rock concert. 
- There was 3 bars that I saw and no line-ups when going to them. 
- The one thing that wasn't set up good was  the merchandise. It blocked one whole section of the doorway so if you wanted to buy merch after the show was over you couldn't really because you were in the way of people wanting to leave...so if you just wanted to look to see what they had you couldn't. And during the show it would be like you were leaving the venue and feared you couldn't get back in. 
- Easy to meet the band at the side of the venue when it was finished. they had barricades set up to. 
- If you go early enough you can stand on the mini step up level from the floor behind the sound/light tech and it's a great spot to stand for a show.

data.title: Cool venue, outrageous beer pricing
data.text: The National has a great atmosphere and pulls decent acts but biggest downfall is the beer selection and pricing.  There aren't a lot of options and everything is way overpriced. We typically pre-game at the house or Penny Lane before we head in just so we don't have to pay their prices.  Otherwise, the facility is great.

data.title: First timers
data.text:
We had never been to a concert here until Rhiannon Giddens was scheduled here. We always enjoy visiting old theatres and love when they are either renovated or still in business. We loved seeing all of grand architectural details.

Concert-wise, we sat on the front row of the balcony where you have a extra leg room but if there are a lot of people sitting in the VIP area at the mezzanine level, your view can be partially blocked by their heads.

data.title: Excellent venue with wonderful acoustics
data.text: I have been to this facility a number of times and have always found it to be a great concert venue.  Bar stations are strategically placed in every corner of the facility so the lines to get a beverage are shorter than may similar in size facilities.  The concert hall has a floor that slants upwards from the stage so there is not a bad spot in the house to see the stage.  There is also a VIP area which has seating and tables.  I just wish they were able to book more national acts as the bands they get in are mainly cover bands or acts that are new in their careers.  As a venue however, I give it an A rating.

data.title: great music venue
data.text: Saw Rhiannon Giddens with her touring band- great experience! good sound system, historic building, multiple bars inside and a really fine restaurant on the side of the building- highly recommended for national/regional touring acts.

data.title: A fine old venue with great entertainment
data.text: The National is a fine venue for seeing music, located in the heart of downtown Richmond. This theater, built in 1923 has been fully restored to its former glory with comfortable seats, a large stage and modern sound system. I have been there several times and every seat seems to have great sight-lines to the stage. There are 2 bars to serve patrons quickly.  There is a parking garage right across the street which you pay as you enter, allowing for a fast exit to the interstate, which is important to me, as I live in Charlottesville. If you love live music in a comfortable atmosphere, you need to check out the changing lineup of acts at the National.

data.title: Best Conncert Venue In Richond
data.text: This place absolutely rocks acoustically and is set in a very intimate, 1960's-style San Fransisco Bay  theater with raised wood paneled walls and floor, raised and inclined center-stage, balcony seating area for a few bucks more, two bars downstairs & one upstairs with reasonable prices on local micro-brews.  They also get the biggest acts coming to town.  You have to go there!!!

data.title: Acoustically amazing
data.text:
We were all thrilled when investors spent of fortune to renovate this historic theater, allowing Richmond to receive larger named bands after so many years with no decent venues. The National is standing room only on the bottom floor with stadium seating upstairs. Depending on the show you may or may not have access to the balcony area. This is often the VIP section for larger acts, not always. That said, if the balcony is open to the General Public you will definitely want to get to the venue early enough to get a table right on the edge of the balcony. That is the best view in the house unless you can score one of the four boxes on either side of the stage. They truly did an amazing job ensuring that this venue would be completely acoustically sound with a floating stage and all kinds of fancy high-tech adaptations. They even reinforced the ceiling to be able to hold the heavy equipment that bands may be using in larger cities. The employees at the national are generally all very nice but the drinks are incredibly overpriced so do your drinking before you go in! You will be paying $12 for a PBR if you do not take this into consideration before whatever show you are seeing. Of course some shows are all ages but generally they have bars set up on both floors, the VIP section and the lobby, as well as the smoking patio area. Getting a drink is not hard, it's just expensive. Of course be careful of getting too intoxicated because they will put you out in a heartbeat if you create any sort of issue in the club. I personally appreciate that in a venue. So, the national is an affordable place to see shows but not an affordable place to drink. It sounds great inside and overall the staff is friendly. What else could you ask for? Like many things in Richmond it is a historic building and that adds extra character. If you can get upstairs into the VIP area there is cool room with old paintings on the wall of children and their toys. It's a little creepy but really cool.
1 tip for out-of-towners is to go ahead and pay to park in the parking deck. Some of the blocks surrounding the National can be a little sketchy at night. Don't bother risking it.

data.title: Cool Place
data.text: Great chill place to catch your favorite indie group, drinks are good and its spacious. Floor seats are standing room so wear comfy shoes.

data.title: Great place to see a show.
data.text: A no nonsense music venue that finally puts to use a great art space in downtown Richmond.  If a band you like is playing there, and they do a nice job of booking, go see them.

data.title: Repeat visitor---
data.text: Great intimate venue.  I have been to a boatload of shows here and it is never disappointing.  The early entry program was a little slow this time (Blackberry Smoke show on Friday March, 11) but, overall a great experience.

data.title: Richmond Gem
data.text: As a music lover from Richmond I've seen countless bands play here and this place never disappoints! Its intimate enough to always get a great view in the pit which is usually always standing (there are exceptions) and there's also a balcony if you want to sit and watch over the crowd below. Would highly recommend.

data.title: Good shows; terrible seats
data.text: The National gets some good acts, but be forewarned; the seats are the most uncomfortable I've ever experienced.  My last visit there was to see the Ben Folds concert and I had to stand the entire time because of the seats.  I'm not kidding; they are terrible.

data.title: Always a FUN Venue
data.text:
The National is a place that does thing right in a simple way and that is very easy to like! We have been here 2 times and We have enjoyed it both times. 

Both  events were concerts and both times we stood right at the front of the stage to see the performances. Clean bathrooms, drink prices were reasonable, tickets were inexpensive too. I HATE the additional fees though. JUST include them into the price and don't tell me!

data.title: Good Venue
data.text: Smaller hall for those bands you really like that cannot fill an arena.  You will stand, which means you can possibly dance or get reserved seats in the balcony.  Resonable pricing, parking close by or take a bus.

data.title: Sick venue w/ classic feel
data.text:
I really enjoyed this venue... The dome ceiling and multiple floors were a nice change from the typical.

The sound could have been better back by the bar area and the drinks seemed overpriced but I still had a hella good time !!
